messages.title: 60 SECOND Q&A with Dr MARK LLOYD DAVIES
messages.content: Various answers given by the candidate on topics such as change, support for the local economy, the NHS, taxes, crime, and the Green Belt.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Cut corporation and business taxes, abolish taxes on the first ten jobs created by new businesses, promote green jobs, and repeal job-killing welfare and work controls.
Promote healthcare by removing layers of bureaucracy and making clinical need and patient safety the top priorities.
Free up the police from bureaucracy so they can cut serious crime, and put more police on streets instead of behind desks.
Scrap Labour's unelected regional planning system, which forces house construction, and let local communities and their elected councils make decisions.

issues.economy: Cut corporation and business taxes, abolish taxes on the first ten jobs created by new businesses, promote green jobs, and repeal job-killing welfare and work controls.
issues.environment: Scrap Labour's unelected regional planning system, which forces house construction, and let local communities and their elected councils make decisions.
issues.health: Promote healthcare by removing layers of bureaucracy and making clinical need and patient safety the top priorities.

housing.content: Scrap Labour's unelected regional planning system, which forces house construction, and let local communities and their elected councils make decisions.

images.caption: Photos of Mark Lloyd Davies and endorsements for his campaign against waste, for protecting the Green Belt, and improving healthcare.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Mark has a PhD in Climate Change and believes in community action.
